content.question: Identical objects, object <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and object <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, are tied together by a string and placed at rest on an incline, as shown in the graph. The string has a length of <math alttext="2 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>â€‰m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The system of the two objects is released from rest, and a graph of the velocity of the center of mass of the system as a function of time is shown in the figure. If the string was cut and object <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was released from rest while object <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was held at rest, which of the following claims is correct about the new acceleration of the center of mass of system <math alttext="a, sub new " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>w</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></math> compared to the original acceleration of the center of mass of the system <math alttext="a, sub original" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>o</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="a, sub new " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>w</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></math> will be greater than <math alttext="a, sub original" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>o</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></math>

<math alttext="a, sub new " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>w</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></math> will be less than <math alttext="a, sub original" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>o</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></math>

<math alttext="a, sub new " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>w</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></math> will be equal to <math alttext="a, sub original" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>o</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></math>

The answer cannot be determined without data provided for the velocity as a function of time for object <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> as it travels down the incline.

content.answer: <math alttext="a, sub new " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>w</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></math> will be less than <math alttext="a, sub original" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>o</mi><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>i</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></mstyle></msub></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
